meanings.definition: Either of the two fleshy parts that form the upper and lower edges of the opening of the mouth.
meanings.sent1: Her lips were red and soft.
meanings.sent2: She applied lipstick to her lips.
meanings.sent3: His lips formed a perfect pout when he saw the surprise.
meanings.sent4: The lips of the river whispered secrets to the trees.
meanings.sent5: The baby's lips curled into a smile as she giggled.

meanings.definition: The edge of a hollow container or an opening.
meanings.sent1: The cup's lips were chipped from frequent use.
meanings.sent2: He sipped from the cup's delicate lips.
meanings.sent3: The lips of the vase were painted with intricate designs.
meanings.sent4: The lips of the cave seemed to whisper ancient echoes.
meanings.sent5: The lips of the bottle were sealed tightly to preserve the contents.

meanings.definition: A projecting edge on a tool or implement.
meanings.sent1: The scissors' lips were sharp and precise.
meanings.sent2: He carefully adjusted the pliers' lips to grip the small object.
meanings.sent3: The lips of the hammer made it easier to pull out the nail.
meanings.sent4: The lips of the wrench gripped the bolt firmly.
meanings.sent5: The lips of the clamp held the pieces together securely.
